name: inconstantly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that does not stay the same or that happens irregularly: The cells were present, although they were too inconstantly labelled for analysis. With age, these events tend to decrease in number and in adult life occur only inconstantly.
More examplesFewer examplesOverall, these mechanisms have been applied too individually and too inconstantly.These cells were only inconstantly found in the specimens that we examined.Previously, procedures around things like annual leave and contracts were inconstantly applied.
